newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy budget spending cuts, revenue mix unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Italy budget spending cuts, revenue mix unchanged.

text.p: After two days of talks among government ministers preparing Italy's 1997 budget, the budget's target blend consisting of two-thirds reduced spending and one-third greater revenue remains unchanged.
Budget ministry undersecretary Giorgio Macciotta told reporters nothing had emerged at the meetings so far to suggest a different blend.
Meetings continued on Wednesday with talks between Treasury and Budget Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi and Health Minister Rosy Bindi.
Ministers in charge of drafting the package have been holding talks with cabinet colleagues on how to pare spending.
The team of troubleshooters, led by Ciampi, has already met Labour Minister Tiziano Treu and state pensions fund chief Gianni Billia.
Under Italian law, the budget package must be presented to parliament by September 30. Both chambers then have until December 31 to approve it.
Prime Minister Romano Prodi's centre-left government is aiming to cut the public sector borrowing requirement by 32.4 trillion lire in 1997.
